name: NotifyBuildStatusToBitbucketRestApi
description: Invoke a Bitbucket REST API as a part of your pipeline to update the build status for the currently built git commit. This is a server-based (agentless) task and can therefore only be used in an agentless job.
author: Swint De Coninck

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Generic service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a generic service connection that should be used to pick the URL and construct authorization header for the http request.

inputs.name: bitbucketBuildStatus
inputs.label: Build status
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build status that should be sent to Bitbucket.

inputs.name: bitbucketBuildKey
inputs.label: Bitbucket build key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build key that should be sent to Bitbucket. The new build status will replace the previously submitted build status for that commit hash and build key. If a single commit was built by multiple build plans, you can POST multiple results for the same commit. Each result must have a different key attribute.

inputs.name: bitbucketBuildName
inputs.label: Bitbucket build name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build key that should be sent to Bitbucket. The new build status will replace the previously submitted build status for that commit hash and build key. If a single commit was built by multiple build plans, you can POST multiple results for the same commit. Each result must have a different key attribute.

inputs.name: bitbucketBuildDescription
inputs.label: Bitbucket build description
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the build description that should be sent to Bitbucket.
